cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 miles southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to slow, then turn west and northwest, tracking very slowly toward the middle–upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas coast near Matagorda Bay–Freeport area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from Port Mansfield to High Island, including Matagorda and Galveston Bays
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (34–50 kt probability up to 52% / 16%). Highest risk Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Matagorda and Galveston Bays, including the Freeport area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain beginning late Sunday with potential totals well over 4 inches and localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the upper Texas coast.
